abstract: Link by Link column observes that for 25 years, the Dover Bookshop in London has offered copyright-free images to graphic artists, educators and others; most of publications at book store are produced by American business Dover Publications; online competition now threatens the business.
snippet: For 25 years, the Dover Bookshop in London has offered copyright-free images to graphic artists, educators, even tattoo artists. But online competition now threatens the business.
lead_paragraph: For 25 years, the Dover Bookshop in London has offered copyright-free images to graphic artists, educators, even tattoo artists. But online competition now threatens the business.

headline.main: A Store of Images, From a Time When ‘Cut and Paste’ Meant Just That
headline.print_headline: A Store of Images, From a Time When ‘Cut and Paste’ Meant Just That
headline.seo: A London Bookstore Sells Clip Art in an Online World
